xxl.core.spatial.rectangles

Class DoublePointRectangle

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.spatial.rectangles.DoublePointRectangle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, Comparable, Descriptor, Convertable, Rectangle
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SpatialHistogramBucket

    public class DoublePointRectangle
extends Object
implements Rectangle
    A high-dimensional Rectangle (=hyper-cube) extends the abstract class Rectangle the value at each dimension should be of the type "double"
    See Also:
    Rectangle, FixedPointRectangle, FloatPointRectangle, Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected double[] leftCorner
      lower-left corner of the rectangle
      protected double[] rightCorner
      upper-right corner of the rectangle

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DoublePointRectangle(double[] leftCorner, double[] rightCorner)
      Creates a new DoublePointRectangle given leftCorner and rightCorner as double arrays (arrays lengths must be equal)
      DoublePointRectangle(DoublePoint leftCorner, DoublePoint rightCorner)
      Creates a new DoublePointRectangle given leftCorner and rightCorner as DoublePoints
      DoublePointRectangle(int dim)
      Creates a new DoublePointRectangle of given dimension with corners (0,0,...,0) and (1,1,...,1)
      DoublePointRectangle(Rectangle rectangle)
      Creates a new DoublePointRectangle as a copy of the given rectangle

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double area()
      Calculates the area (volume) of this rectangle as a double-point value.
      Object clone()
      Create and returns a physical copy of this rectangle.
      int compareTo(Object object)
      Compares first coordinate of leftCorner Points of this and another given rectangle.
      boolean contains(Descriptor descriptor)
      Checks whether the rectangle contains an object in form of Tree.Descriptor.
      boolean contains(Point point)
      Checks whether the rectangle contains the given double point
      double[] deltas()
      Returns the delta (vector containing size on each dimention) of this rectangle as an array of double-point values
      int dimensions()
      Returns the dimensionality of this rectangle.
      double distance(Rectangle rectangle, int p)
      Computes the shortest distance between this rectangle and another given rectangle using the Lp-Metric.
      boolean equals(Object object)
      Checks whether the rectangle is equal to another object given.
      DoublePoint getCenter()
      Computes the center of this rectangle
      Point getCorner(boolean right)
      Returns the left/right corner point of this rectangle.
      Point[] getCorners()
      Returns all corners of rectangle
      int hashCode()
      Calculates hash code of this rectangle
      void intersect(Rectangle rectangle)
      Computes the intersection of this rectangle and another given rectangle and stores the result instead of source rectangle.
      double margin()
      Calculates the margin (perimeter) of this rectangle as a double-point value.
      double maxDistance(Point point, int p)
      Computes the distance between the given point and the most distant point of this rectangle using the specified Lp-Metric.
      double minDistance(Point point, int p)
      Computes the distance between the given point and the nearest point of this rectangle using the specified Lp-Metrics.
      DoublePointRectangle normalize(Rectangle universe)
      Normalizes this rectangle to the unit-space [0;1)^dim using the given universe
      double overlap(Rectangle rectangle)
      Computes the area of overlap between this rectangle and another given one.
      boolean overlaps(Descriptor descriptor)
      Checks whether this rectangle overlaps an object in form of Tree.Descriptor.
      boolean overlaps(Rectangle rectangle, int dimension)
      Checks whether this rectangle overlaps another given rectangle at a given dimension.

      Reads the state (the attributes) for an object of this class from the specified data input and restores the calling object.
      String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this rectangle.
      void union(Descriptor descriptor)
      Creates rectangle witch represents the result of the union of this rectangle and another given object in form Tree.Descriptor and and stores the result instead of source rectangle.
      void write(DataOutput dataOutput)
      Writes the state (the attributes) of the calling object to the specified data output.

      • read

        public void read(DataInput dataInput)
          throws IOException
        Reads the state (the attributes) for an object of this class from the specified data input and restores the calling object. The state of the object before calling read will be lost.
        The read method must read the values in the same sequence and with the same types as were written by write.
        Specified by:
        read in interface Convertable
        Parameters:
        dataInput - the stream to read data from in order to restore the object.
        Throws:
        IOException - if I/O errors occur.

      • write

        public void write(DataOutput dataOutput)
           throws IOException
        Writes the state (the attributes) of the calling object to the specified data output. This method should serialize the state of this object without calling another write method in order to prevent recursions.
        Specified by:
        write in interface Convertable
        Parameters:
        dataOutput - the stream to write the state (the attributes) of the object to.
        Throws:
        IOException - includes any I/O exceptions that may occur.

        Returns the left/right corner point of this rectangle.
        Specified by:
        getCorner in interface Rectangle
        Parameters:
        right - if this parameter is set to true upper-right corner will be returned otherwise it will be lower-left corner
        Returns:
        returns corner point of this rectangle (upper-right or lower-left depending on the input boolean parameter right)

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Object object)
        Compares first coordinate of leftCorner Points of this and another given rectangle. Returns -1, if the value is smaller for this rectangle 0, if values are equal 1, if the value is bigger for this rectangle
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface Comparable
        Parameters:
        object - is the DoublePointRectangle object, which will be compared with this rectangle.
        Returns:
        returns the result of the comparison

        public void union(Descriptor descriptor)
        Creates rectangle witch represents the result of the union of this rectangle and another given object in form Tree.Descriptor and and stores the result instead of source rectangle. Attention! Source rectangle is modified.
        Specified by:
        union in interface Descriptor
        Parameters:

      • intersect

        public void intersect(Rectangle rectangle)
        Computes the intersection of this rectangle and another given rectangle and stores the result instead of source rectangle. Attention! Source rectangle is modified. There will be a exception IllegalArgumentException if they do not overlap
        Specified by:
        intersect in interface Rectangle
        Parameters:
        rectangle -
